article_title: San Antonio tax info for procrastinators
article_text:
San Antonio tax info for procrastinators

Photo: Bloomberg News File If you cannot pay your entire tax bill, pay a portion of it. “You...

Federal income taxpayers may have an extra three days to file or mail their returns this year, but the deadline is approaching rapidly for those who procrastinate.

article_metadata.description: The Main Post Office in San Antonio at 10410 Perrin Beitel Road no longer operates curbside pickup for people mailing returns on the night of the deadline because more than 80 percent of income-tax forms are filed electronically.  [...] for people who do still mail income-tax forms, the last collection time at the Perrin-Beitel Road Main Office — and San Antonio — will be midnight Monday, for both inside and outside collection boxes.  Another late option in San Antonio is the U.S. Postal Service’s air mail facility at 10250 John Saunders Road near San Antonio International Airport; it will be open until 10 p.m.  Any mail deposited after the last posted collection time will not be postmarked until the following day, resulting in late-filing penalties if it’s your tax return.  For people needing help completing the tax forms, San Antonio’s Volunteer Income Tax Assistance program, called VITA, will offer free preparation services to qualified taxpayers through Monday at 19 sites on a walk-in basis.
article_metadata.author.name: By David Hendricks, Staff Writer

For people needing help completing the tax forms, San Antonio’s Volunteer Income Tax Assistance program, called VITA, will offer free preparation services to qualified taxpayers through Monday at 19 sites on a walk-in basis.
